abstract_summ: Failure of reperfusion was defined as thrombolysis in cerebral infarction (TICI) grades 0/1/2a, and sufficient refusion as TICI 2b/3a . Failure of re-fusion occurred in 371 patients (16.8%) and was associated with cervical ICA stenosis, cervical internal carotid artery (ICA, adjusted odds ratio, OR 2.90, 95% CI 1.69-4.97), stroke of other determined etiology by TOAST (Trial of ORG 10172 in acute stroke treatment) criteria (e.g. nonatherosclerotic vasculopathies)
